comment.text: This translation key is used to display the phrase "Remember me" as a label for a checkbox on a login form. It appears on a Forgot Container component, likely in a password recovery or authentication dialog. Translators should provide a brief, intuitive text that users can click on when selecting this option.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "تذكرنى" (tadhakrani) literally means "remember me" but is considered quite informal and might be awkward in some contexts. A more formal and widely accepted translation for a "Remember me" option (e.g., on a login form) would be "تَذَكَّرْنِي" (tadhakkarnee).
While 'Yadda saxla' is a literal translation of 'Remember,' it doesn't convey the intended meaning of 'Remember me' in the context of login or personalization. It sounds more like 'Save in memory.'
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: A more appropriate translation would be something like 'Mənı xatizlə' or 'Mənı unudma' depending on the specific nuance desired.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The German translation 'Anmeldedaten speichern' translates to 'Save login details' which is not an exact equivalent of 'Remember me'. While functionally similar, the meaning is slightly different. 'Remember me' implies a passive remembering, while 'Anmeldedaten speichern' implies an action taken by the system to save the login details.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider alternatives like 'Merken' or 'Mich erinnern' for a more direct translation of 'Remember me'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Απομνημόνευση των στοιχείων μου' (Apomnimonevsi ton stoicheion mou) is a very literal translation that means 'Memorization of my details'. It's not a natural way to express 'Remember me' in Greek.  It sounds overly formal and technical.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: A more natural translation would be something like 'Να με θυμάσαι' (Na me thymasei) which means 'Remember me' or 'Keep me in mind'. Alternatively, 'Θυμήσου με' (Thimiso me) is a direct and common translation for 'Remember me'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Japanese translation "保存" (Hozon) means "save" or "storage" and doesn't accurately convey the meaning of "Remember me".  It's not a direct or appropriate translation.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: A more accurate translation would be something like "ログイン状態を維持する" (Login joutai o iji suru) or "私を覚える" (Watashi o oboeru).  Context might dictate the best option.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: '저장하기' translates to 'Save' or 'Save settings', not 'Remember me'. It doesn't convey the meaning of remembering a user's login state.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: A more appropriate translation would be '나를 기억하기' (na-reul gi-eok-ha-gi) or '로그인 기억' (lo-gi-in gi-eok).

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The direct translation 'Pamiętaj mnie' is grammatically correct but sounds unnatural in Polish. The standard and more natural way to express 'Remember me' is 'Zapamiętaj mnie' or 'Pamiętaj o mnie'.

The translation 'Lembrar a minha sessão' is a literal translation that doesn't quite convey the intended meaning of 'Remember me'. It translates to 'Remember my session,' which is more technical than the simple 'Remember me' used for user login.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: A better translation would be 'Manter-me conectado' or 'Ficar conectado' depending on the context and desired level of formality. Alternatively, 'Lembrar minhas informações' (Remember my information) is also a reasonable option.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "Запомнить" (Zapomnit') means "to remember" or "to memorize", but it doesn't convey the meaning of "Remember me", which is a request to be recognized and kept logged in. It's a prompt asking a system to retain user information.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: A more accurate translation would be "Помнить меня" (Pomnit' menya) or "Запомни меня" (Zapomni menya).

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While "මතක තබාගන්න" (mathak thaba-ganna) is a valid phrase, it translates more literally to "remember and keep" or "retain".  The most natural and common translation of "Remember me" in Sinhala would be "මා මතක් කරන්න" (maa mathak karan-na).

The translation "Zapamätať si ma" is grammatically correct but doesn't convey the intended meaning of "Remember me" in the context of a login or authentication feature. It translates more literally as 'to remember me' instead of a command or request to remember the user's credentials.
